value.description: The URL to pull from
value.name: URL

value.description: The filename to assign to the file when pulled
value.name: Filename

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Username required to access the URL
value.name: Username

value.description: Password required to access the URL
value.name: Password

value.description: How long to wait when attempting to connect to the remote server before giving up
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: How long to wait between receiving segments of data from the remote server before giving up and discarding the partial file
value.name: Data Timeout

value.description: What to report as the User Agent when we connect to the remote server
value.name: User Agent

value.description: If specified, requests will only accept the provided Content-Type
value.name: Accept Content-Type

value.description: If we receive a 3xx HTTP Status Code from the server, indicates whether or not we should follow the redirect that the server specifies
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

relationships.description: All files are transferred to the success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

allowableValues.description: Batch messages before sending them to Kafka. While this will improve throughput, it opens the possibility that a failure on the client machine will drop unsent data.

value.description: This parameter specifies whether the messages are sent asynchronously in a background thread.
value.name: Producer Type

value.description: Used only if Producer Type is set to "Asynchronous". The number of messages to send in one batch when using Asynchronous mode. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Used only if Producer Type is set to "Asynchronous". The maximum number of unsent messages that can be queued up in the producer when using Asynchronous mode before either the producer must be blocked or data must be dropped.
value.name: Queue Buffer Max Count

value.description: Used only if Producer Type is set to "Asynchronous". Maximum time to buffer data when using Asynchronous mode. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100ms of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

value.description: Used only if Producer Type is set to "Asynchronous". The amount of time to block before dropping messages when running in Asynchronous mode and the buffer has reached the "Queue Buffer Max Count". If set to 0, events will be enqueued immediately or dropped if the queue is full (the producer send call will never block). If not set, the producer will block indefinitely and never willingly drop a send.
value.name: Queue Enqueue Timeout

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: This parameter allows you to set whether compression should be turned on for particular topics. If the compression codec is anything other than "None", enable compression only for specified topics if any. If the list of compressed topics is empty, then enable the specified compression codec for all topics. If the compression codec is None, compression is disabled for all topics
value.name: Compressed Topics

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A JsonPath expression that indicates the array element to split into JSON/scalar fragments.
value.name: JsonPath Expression

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile is not valid JSON or the specified path does not exist), it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile that was split into segments. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: All segments of the original FlowFile will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: split
